author: gpkumar24
title: Discounted Services for Delegation
description: People with business ideas / services may not have enough funding to get started

f6_assessments.q0:
In my opinion this proposal could improve the stakeholder participations in the Cardano community Stake Pool Operators and the developer work on cardano blockchain, but It isn't clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for the stakeholders (in deep detail for users, developers and so on.. ).
Actually any SPO's risk himself and doesn't need to funding his Pool with catalyst funding, so what are the benefit of this proposal for cardano community?
However the objective of the proposal is interesting and it's good for growth the community, but I think it's important to improve details about the solution for the challenge, so it's difficult to assess.
f6_assessments.q1: It's not simple to define if the proposer team states has the necessary experience, because it's clear the experience as user in general, but I don't discover team member details and professional experience to imagine the project's success. The metrics for the assessment isn't given, so it's impossible to assess what the proposer wants to do, but the success of his actions is not defined. Roadmap and milestones (incl. time horizon) are not very well described.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap and milestones (incl. time horizon) are not very well described. The budget's information provided is very poor and it is difficult assess. There aren't KPI to identify the proposal goal, but only deliverables. There aren't more details how the budget is going to be spent, also I'm trying to discover attachment to deep dive the solution. Futhermore there aren't basic information to asses.

f6_assessments.q0: The Proposal identifies the problem of new business ideas for SPOs. They will ad value to Cardano by bringing lots of new small businesses and their customers to the  ecosystem. The key metrics are aligned with the challenge in the sense of creating new business ideas. This project will be able to scale well as it will be beneficial to have many SPOs in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: No proof of existence or relevant skills are provided. In order to gain the community's trust, they need to see at least some proof of your skills. The budget is for paying the salaries of a system admin and a marketing team for 4 months. You could ad the hourly rate and intended hours required for this job for an even better break down of the budget. They aim to establish partnerships with at least 5 businesses in Q1 2022. It seems doable, but more likely if you already have the marketing team on board. They explain the intended benefits of their product, but don't really provide any details on how this will be built/achieved. For example they claim "Consumers would love to see their holdings grow / rewarded and get discounts on their purchases" Will there be an application for this? How do they track and calculate this discount? Explaining these details will show the voter your approach and could potentially boost voter confidence in your abilities to make this project succeed. No risks or challenges were considered. Not being aware or prepared for risks will slow you down.
f6_assessments.q2: They Show different stages, which I suppose could be the roadmap, but there is only a timestamp on stage 1, the rest have no timestamps. It would make it easier to track the progress of your project if you put timestamps on all the stages. Very little KPIs were provided. In order to track the performance of your project it would help a lot to ad user based KPIs, like how many businesses onboarded at different points in time. How many loyalty tokens issued etc. They identify the problem of creating new business ideas for SPOs and they intend to solve this by letting existing businesses use stake pools to offer their customers discount when they delegate to their stake pools.

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications: As a year-long activist in both party-politics and non-party related political (grassroots) groups I know how important decentralised communities are for democratic and economic empowerment, which also applies to decentralized and partially mission-driven stakepools, especially regarding the economic part. This knowledge and my knowledge about mission driven stakepools enables me to provide valuable insights for this challenge. The proposal identifies a problem which actually is not really a problem since it is a pretty straightforward step-by-step process to set up a stakepool. You don't really need to hire experts for that. Also, in my opinion a service that offers just anyone to emit their own tokens is neither beneficial for the credibility of Cardano nor of the Crypto sector as a whole. Hence, I am not sure how this proposal will add value to the Cardano ecosystem.
This proposal is less adressed to SPOs than to businesses, so the key metrics and goals of the proposal only align partially with the outlined challenge settings.
The proposer adresses sclalability, which seems legitimate.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer does not provide sufficient information about themselves and does not provide proof for any relevant qualifications. Feedback: For future proposals, maybe consider linking some verifiable personal information about yourself or some of the work you have already done. The proposer does not seem to know the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal, as they want to hire two people for a job that could probably, at least in the startup phase, by themselves. Feedback: There are several tutorials and guides on the internet on how to set up a stakepool I suggest, if you are serious about this idea, you use all these resources to teach yourself to set up a stakepool yourself and than start this business idea without hiring several people. It's always good to start small until you have built yourself up a stable customer base.
The budget is not outlined clearly nor broken down into identifiable items. The proposer only mentions a lump sum and some points for which it is used. Feedback. A budget broken down by items should be used next time.
Since the budget is not broken down and a large proportion of the proposal could be done without extra hired people by just going through freely available guides, the budget does not seem reasonable.
The proposal does not offer a timetable to complete the work.
The overall implementation plan lacks sophistication and technical detail, which gives the impression the proposer does not exactly know the technical backgrounds of their own proposal, which should be a prerequisite for posting a proposal. The plan does not describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal other than some people they want to hire.
 The proposer has not done a general assessment of challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
While a roadmap with milestones exists, they don't have a time horizon which will make it difficult to audit them.  Metrics and KPIs that define the success of the proposal are not presented in a concrete, quantitative manner, but only as some coarsely-defined qualitative points of what shoulde be achieved.
 While thed escription of the targeted problem is sufficiently comprehensible,
The desctiption of the solution that addresses the problem is not sufficiently detailed.
